bibl.title: Letter from Albert G. Love to Bessie M. Griswold, December 20, 1951

div1.p: Love thanks Griswold for her monetary gift to the Walter Reed Memorial Association.

div1.head: Letter from Albert G. Love to Bessie M. Griswold, December 20, 1951
div1.opener:
December 20, 1951
Mrs. Bessie M. Griswold,
5017 Pon Valley Road,
Bloomfield Hills, Michigan.
My dear Mrs. Griswold,
div1.p:
Dr. Philip S. Hench, Mayo Clinic, Rochester, Minnesota,
has forwarded to me, as Secretary of the Walter Reed Memo-
rial Association, your check for $25.00 that you handed to
the Rev. Hubert S. Beckwith as a memorial in memory of Pfc.
James W. Beaumont, who made the supreme sacrifice for his
country in Korea on November 2, 1951.

I wish to express to you the sincere appreciation of
the Association and also to express to the family of Pfc.
Beaumont our sincere sympathy in their great bereavement.

The Walter Reed Memorial Association was organized at
a meeting of distinguished scientists in Bar Harbor, Maine
on August 15, 1903. The Association was organized and a
resolution was adopted to raise $25,000.00 as a memorial
fund. After continuous effort extending through 18 months
that amount was raised. Since that date the income was paid
to Mrs. Reed until her death in August 1950 and since that
date has been paid to their unmarried daughter, Miss Blossom
Reed. After her death the fund that now has a market value
of approximately $35,000.00 will be used to establish a
scholarship at the Medical School of the University of Vir-
ginia where Major Reed graduated.

The gift will be recorded as a memorial to Pfc. James
W. Beaumont.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Albert G. Love,
Secretary, Walter Reed
Memorial Association. cc to: Dr. Philip S. Hench
